TopicTitle: Stock Crater Crusher vehicle has one of its solar panels pointing down

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.1.4 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Windows 11 | CPU: AMD Ryzen 5 7600X | GPU: Nvidia RTX 4070 | RAM: 32 GB DDR5

 

The stock Mk 2 Crater Crusher vehicle has one of its Gigantor solar panels pointing down and one pointing up.

 

Included Attachments:

Edited September 6, 2023 by Anth12

@Vl3d I was wondering if you could supply the craft file for that?

If you can, can you do the following?:

  1. Post a new bug report with the craft file
  2. Have my name in the title
  3. Have a link to here in the body

9 hours ago, Anth12 said:

@Vl3d I was wondering if you could supply the craft file for that?

If you can, can you do the following?:

  1. Post a new bug report with the craft file
  2. Have my name in the title
  3. Have a link to here in the body

Can't you get the craft by turning on 'Stock Vessels'?

It is a stock craft and it has always been like that (how the devs built it and not notice is beyond me). Then again, the wheelbase isn't connected to the rest of the craft so the whole thing looks like made with AI 

Edited September 7, 2023 by The Aziz

@Vl3d @TechieV @The Aziz Oh. Sorry. Its been a busy time after 0.1.4.0 with a lot more bug reports coming in than I expected, and I completely missed the mention of stock in the title.

More people came back to report bugs this time around, new, and old ones that existed before 0.1.4.0
Its great. I am betting that I am going to be even more busy when Science comes around.

Edited September 7, 2023 by Anth12

It's worse than just having one going up and one going down. The solar panels are clipped in wrong as well.

And the front and rear chassis are just floating as well. The struts don't hide that fact well enough.

And then there is also this. Neither antennas are correct.
Wait, and the RCS block on the left....

There's a lot wrong with this stock craft.

52 minutes ago, Anth12 said:

There's a lot wrong with this stock craft.

Oversights like this - having bugs in stock vessels which have been in production for 6 months - make me question if there's actually any real QA being done for the user facing build.

I don't doubt that there's a priority list of bugs and that there's been a lot of testing and maintenance work for the backend.. but come on. The Crater Crusher wheels are also completely unusable.. makes me wonder what the devs are actually playing weekly that no one has seen these obvious issues or gotten around to fixing them.

It's not acceptable to have bugs in the stock vessels. It means no one plays the user facing game.

The craft is actually featured in the EA trailer.

Edited September 7, 2023 by Vl3d

I've been having completely the same feeling. I'm befuddled enough that this kind of this happens at all, given all the delaying initially done for 'polish', but the fact something so extremely simple to fix hasn't been touched in over six months is even less explicable. Definitely lends to my impression that there's little care given to user experience
